intro: Sobralia bella, commonly known as the beauty of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, tropical environments. Its leaves are often arranged in a rosette and can store water, aiding in its survival in its natural habitat. Sobralia bella produces vibrant flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, which bloom during the warmer months.
